name: parseable
description: Parseable is an open-source, self-hosted log management system built for low-cost ingestion, querying, and retention. It offers real-time analytics, dashboards, and S3 support.
features: Log ingestion: High-performance log collection from multiple sources with support for various formats and protocols
Real-time analytics: Query and analyze logs in real-time with SQL-like syntax for immediate insights into system behavior
S3 storage: Store logs in S3-compatible object storage for cost-effective, scalable long-term retention
Custom dashboards: Build visual dashboards with charts and graphs to monitor key metrics and log patterns over time
Query language: Powerful query syntax enables complex filtering, aggregation, and analysis of log data for troubleshooting
Low-cost operation: Optimized architecture minimizes storage and compute costs compared to traditional log management solutions
Retention policies: Configure automatic log retention and deletion rules to manage storage costs and comply with data policies
API access: RESTful API enables programmatic log ingestion, querying, and integration with external tools and workflows
Alert configuration: Set up alerts based on log patterns or thresholds to proactively detect and respond to issues
Multi-tenant support: Isolate logs by tenant or application with separate namespaces for secure multi-team deployments
